page.title: 05WHITLEY BRIDGE VILLAGE.(1)
page.content: Whitley bridge is a mainly post-war village,consisting of stone cottages,and one small estate with more modern houses. In the village, the average number of people living in each house is Three. Two members from each house are over Eighteen years old. Over 60% of the local population are either retired or unemployed and the rest either work or go to school.Of those who are employed,most work for local firms or are self-employed.Others work at Eggborough Power Station,which is about 1 Kilometre away. About 70% of the houses are privately owned, and the majority of them have been built for about twenty years. About 90% of the householders own their own transport. The only Annual event is a Gala at the local Community Centre.
